text.__SUMMARY__: The Darwin blind snake (Anilios tovelli )  is a species of snake in the family Typhlopidae. The species is endemic to Australia.
text.Etymology: The specific name, tovelli, is in honor of G. T. R. Tovell who collected the holotype while serving as a gunner in the Australian armed forces during World War II.
text.Geographic range: In Australia, A. tovelli is found in the Northern Territory.
text.Further reading:
Hedges SB, Marion AB, Lipp KM, Marin J, Vidal N (2014). "A taxonomic framework for typhlopid snakes from the Caribbean and other regions (Reptilia, Squamata)". Caribbean Herpetology (49): 1-61. (Anilios tovelli, new combination).
Loveridge A (1945). "A New Blind Snake (Typhlops tovelli ) from Darwin, Australia". Proc. Biol. Soc. Washington 58: 111-112. (Typhlops tovelli, new species).
Wallach V (2006). "The nomenclatural status of Australian Ramphotyphlops (Serpentes: Typhlopidae)". Bull. Maryland Herp. Soc. 42 (1): 8-24. (Austrotyphlops tovelli, new combination).
